I. A BRIEF PARAPHRASE
Ihe speaker, perhaps talking to a child, tells her that the gun on the wall
(symbolic of war and its attendant human anguish) will become rusty through
disuse and almost forgotten. People seeing the gun will be pleased to see it
covered with spider webs.
